alert.note: Alert for Pribilof Islands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 20 at 4:47AM AKST until February 21 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 45 to 55 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Pribilof Islands. * WHEN...From late tonight through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A rapidly approaching North Pacific low pressure system will enter the Bering today. This system is expected to produce high winds along the Central Aleutians tonight into Tuesday morning. Confidence is growing that this core of elevated winds will persist as the low advances northward toward the Pribilofs Tuesday morning. Wind direction is currently expected to be southwest. This wind flow appears favorable to produce waves up to 25 feet near St. Paul harbor.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
